title: Authors and Citation
text: Thomas Westbrook. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Westbrook T (2023). GOeval: Gene Regulatory Network Evaluation Using Gene Ontology. R package version 1.0.0, https://westbrooktm.github.io/GOeval/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {GOeval: Gene Regulatory Network Evaluation Using Gene Ontology},   author = {Thomas Westbrook},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://westbrooktm.github.io/GOeval/}, }

what: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
title: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
text: Given one network, evaluate first make subsets subset_network, run -Representation Analysis (ORA) webgestalt_network, followed get_metrics plot_metrics plot selected summary statistics.

title: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
code: evaluate(   network,   reference_set,   output_directory,   network_name,   organism = "hsapiens",   database = "geneontology_Biological_Process_noRedundant",   gene_id = "ensembl_gene_id",   edges = c(512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, 16384, 32768, 65536),   num_possible_TFs = 0,   permutations = 3,   penalty = 3,   fdr_threshold = 0.05,   get_sum = TRUE,   get_percent = FALSE,   get_mean = FALSE,   get_median = FALSE,   get_annotation_overlap = FALSE,   get_size = TRUE,   plot = TRUE )

title: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
text: network path file containing network create subsets . file tab-separated three columns: source node, target node, edge score reference_set path set genes possibly included network. Must .txt file containing exactly one column genes possibly appear network. output_directory path directory store generated network subsets, ORA summaries, plots network_name short name network - used file naming may contain spaces organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae" - see options WebGestaltR::listOrganism() database gene set database search enrichment - see options WebGestaltR::listGeneSet(). Must Gene Ontology "biological process" database get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. gene_id naming system used input genes - see options WebGestaltR::listIdType() see webgestalt.org examples type edges list total numbers edges average edges per TF include subset num_possible_TFs set number > 0, elements 'edges' first multiplied number get number edges subset permutations number randomly permuted networks create run ORA penalty penalty applied 'sum' metric TF network fdr_threshold FDR threshold gene set term considered significantly -represented purposes calculating 'percent' metric get_sum boolean whether get plot 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term source node minus 'penalty' times total number source nodes. get_percent boolean whether get plot 'percent' metric, percent source nodes least one term FDR 'fdr_threshold' get_mean boolean whether get plot 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_median boolean whether get plot 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_annotation_overlap boolean whether get plot 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent source nodes annotated least one 16 GO terms target genes enriched get_size boolean whether get plot 'size' metric, number source nodes network subset one target gene annotations. number used calculation metrics. plot boolean whether make plots calculated metrics write pdf

title: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
text: output get_metrics. Can used input plot_metrics.

title: Perform the whole GOeval pipeline on one network — evaluate
text: input file tab-separated two three columns: source node (e.g. transcription factor), target node (e.g. regulated gene), , optionally, edge score.

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_annotation_overlap
text: function calculates percent source nodes annotated GO term either regulates GO term target genes enriched

Helper function for get_metrics — get_annotation_overlap
text: terms data.frame obtained calling get_terms folder summaries output webgestalt_network organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae" gene_id naming system used input genes - see options WebGestaltR::listIdType() see webgestalt.org examples type go_ann data.frame annotations genes GO terms. Obtain WebGestaltR::loadGeneSet. go_reg data.frame regulatory relationships GO terms. Obtain ontologyIndex::get_ontology.

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_annotation_overlap
text: list source nodes

what: Get summary metrics of a network's ORA results — get_metrics
title: Get summary metrics of a network's ORA results — get_metrics
text: get_metrics creates data.frame contains specified metrics network subsets permutations subdirectory provided path. designed run output webgestalt_network function prepare summary metrics plotting plot_metrics function. 'directory' path contain directories created webgestalt_network.

title: Get summary metrics of a network's ORA results — get_metrics
code: get_metrics(   directory,   organism = "hsapiens",   database = "geneontology_Biological_Process_noRedundant",   gene_id = "ensembl_gene_id",   get_sum = TRUE,   get_percent = FALSE,   get_mean = FALSE,   get_median = FALSE,   get_annotation_overlap = FALSE,   get_size = TRUE,   penalty = 3,   fdr_threshold = 0.05,   parallel = FALSE )

title: Get summary metrics of a network's ORA results — get_metrics
text: directory directory containing directories ORA summaries created webgestalt_network networks interest organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae". required get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. database gene set database search enrichment - see options WebGestaltR::listGeneSet(). Must Gene Ontology "biological process" database get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. gene_id naming system used input genes - see options WebGestaltR::listIdType() see webgestalt.org examples type. required get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. get_sum boolean whether get 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term source node minus 'penalty' times total number source nodes. get_percent boolean whether get 'percent' metric, percent source nodes least one term FDR 'fdr_threshold' get_mean boolean whether get 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_median boolean whether get 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_annotation_overlap boolean whether get 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent source nodes annotated least one 16 GO terms target genes enriched get_size boolean whether get 'size' metric, number source nodes network subset one target gene annotations. number used calculation metrics. penalty penalty applied 'sum' metric TF network fdr_threshold FDR threshold gene set term considered significantly -represented purposes calculating 'percent' metric parallel boolean whether get metrics network directory parallel - use caution, adequately tested

title: Get summary metrics of a network's ORA results — get_metrics
text: list data.frames, containing values one metric. columns data.frame represent different subset sizes, rows represent different network permutations. first row unpermuted networks.

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_network_metrics
text: helper function computes desired metrics data.frame top terms source node network.

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_network_metrics
code: get_network_metrics(   full_terms,   network_size,   organism,   gene_id,   get_sum,   get_percent,   get_mean,   get_median,   get_annotation_overlap,   get_size,   penalty,   fdr_threshold,   go_ann = NULL,   go_reg = NULL )

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_network_metrics
text: full_terms data.frame containing summary results network. Use get_terms obtain. network_size number source nodes network organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae" gene_id naming system used input genes - see options WebGestaltR::listIdType() see webgestalt.org examples type get_sum boolean whether get 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term source node minus 'penalty' times total number source nodes. get_percent boolean whether get 'percent' metric, percent source nodes least one term FDR 'fdr_threshold' get_mean boolean whether get 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_median boolean whether get 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance get_annotation_overlap boolean whether get 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent source nodes annotated least one 16 GO terms target genes enriched get_size boolean whether get 'size' metric, number source nodes network subset one target gene annotations. number used calculation metrics. penalty penalty applied 'sum' metric source node network fdr_threshold FDR threshold gene set term considered significantly -represented purposes calculating 'percent' metric go_ann data.frame annotations genes GO terms. Obtain WebGestaltR::loadGeneSet. go_reg data.frame regulatory relationships GO terms. Obtain ontologyIndex::get_ontology.

title: Helper function for get_metrics — get_network_metrics
text: list metric values

text: path folder containing .csv files ORA summaries output webgestalt_network n number terms summary get data

what: Plot the summary metrics from get_metrics — plot_metrics
title: Plot the summary metrics from get_metrics — plot_metrics
text: plot_metrics creates plots summary metrics calculated get_metrics. making 'metric_dfs_by_net' argument list multiple outputs get_metrics, can plot metrics multiple networks graphs. x-axis based network subset sizes.

title: Plot the summary metrics from get_metrics — plot_metrics
code: plot_metrics(   metric_dfs_by_net,   title_text,   subtitle_text = "",   perTF,   sum = TRUE,   percent = FALSE,   mean = FALSE,   median = FALSE,   annotation_overlap = FALSE,   size = TRUE )

title: Plot the summary metrics from get_metrics — plot_metrics
text: metric_dfs_by_net list outputs get_metrics title_text text title every plot; generally names networks subtitle_text text subtitle every plot perTF boolean whether network subset sizes specified average target genes per TF; changes x-axis label sum boolean whether plot 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term source node minus penalty times total number source nodes. percent boolean whether plot 'percent' metric, percent source nodes least one term FDR threshold mean boolean whether plot 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance median boolean whether plot 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term source node regardless significance annotation_overlap boolean whether plot 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent source nodes annotated least one 16 GO terms target genes enriched size boolean whether plot 'size' metric, number source nodes network subset one target gene annotations

title: Plot the summary metrics from get_metrics — plot_metrics
text: list data.frames containing values one metric. column names denote network subset. first row data.frame real networks; rest permuted networks.

what: Create network subsets with highest scored edges — subset_network
title: Create network subsets with highest scored edges — subset_network
text: Given network edge scores, subset_network sorts network descending order score creates subsets using top given numbers edges. size subsets can either determined total number edges ('num_possible_TFs' specified) desired average number target nodes possible source node ('num_possible_TFs' set number > 0). latter option multiplies element 'edges' 'num_possible_TFs' get number edges subset.

title: Create network subsets with highest scored edges — subset_network
Create network subsets with highest scored edges — subset_network
text: input_file file containing network create subsets . file tab-separated three columns: source node, target node, edge score output_directory name folder place created network subset files name base name created network subset files edges list total numbers edges average edges per TF include subset num_possible_TFs set number > 0, elements 'edges' first multiplied number get number edges subset

title: Create network subsets with highest scored edges — subset_network
text: input file tab-separated three columns: source node (e.g. transcription factor), target node (e.g. regulated gene), edge score. output files tab-separated two columns: source node, target node.

what: Generate ORA results for a network and a given number of permutations — webgestalt_network
title: Generate ORA results for a network and a given number of permutations — webgestalt_network
text: Given network network subset, webgestalt_network generate -Representation Analysis (ORA) results network given number permutations. stored directory named "network_name" within specified output_directory, contains folder "p0" input network folders "p1", "p2", different permutations network. Within folders .csv files source node. files contain information gene set terms -represented source node's targets. function also creates "webgestalt_work" directory output_directory, structure "network_name" directory, files .txt files containing list targets source node.

title: Generate ORA results for a network and a given number of permutations — webgestalt_network
code: webgestalt_network(   network_path,   reference_set,   output_directory,   network_name,   organism = "hsapiens",   database = "geneontology_Biological_Process_noRedundant",   gene_id = "ensembl_gene_id",   permutations = 10 )

title: Generate ORA results for a network and a given number of permutations — webgestalt_network
text: network_path path network network subset evaluate. Must tab-separated file first column source nodes (TFs) second column target nodes (regulated genes). reference_set path set genes possibly included network. Must .txt file containing exactly one column genes possibly appear network. output_directory path directory output stored. recommended make dedicated directory output network subsets single original network. network_name name directory store results within output_directory. format files output subset_network: "{name}_{# edges}" .e. "example_8". organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae" - see options WebGestaltR::listOrganism() database gene set database search enrichment - see options WebGestaltR::listGeneSet() gene_id naming system used input genes - see options WebGestaltR::listIdType() see webgestalt.org examples type permutations number randomly permuted networks create run ORA

title: Generate ORA results for a network and a given number of permutations — webgestalt_network
text: input network file tab-separated .tsv first column source nodes (TFs) second column target nodes (regulated genes).
